data.title: laid back cool
data.text: This place is a little bar in downtown napa tucked back into a corner.  We stopped in here while we were exploring downtown napa after a day of wine drinking.  I immediately liked this place a I noticed they had a record player playing records in the corner with very good albums for your listening pleasure.  As with everywhere in napa they had good wine but I decided to try a flight of their craft beer which was good.

data.title: Bad general feeling
data.text: We ordered 2 flights of wine (3  reds and 3 whites) and we had the luck of having the very bottom of the bottle of six "amazing" napa wines. The guy who served us looked really nice with his usual customers but with us, normal tourists that just want to taste some wine, he had no interest and was rude.

data.title: Nice but awkward
data.text: My wife and I came here with another couple. It's a small space. We were met by Jordan. She was very nice and informative. The food selection was ok, but we decided on tapas and beer. The place was slow being that it was a Tuesday. Since we were bored we decided to play a game on our iPhone. Well, couple of minuets later we were told we were being too loud. That totally changed the mood. We just stopped playing the game because the the complaining couple made it weird....check please. Not coming back again, even though we threw down some cash. If you have another choice, go somewhere else where you can talk.

data.title: Not for a solo traveller
data.text:
I visited here because it had some great reviews on trip advisor and looked a lovely place.  The staff were friendly enough but its not the type of place to visit if you're a solo traveller.  Even if there are locals there its not the type of place someone's going to sit and chat to you.
However the selection of beer and wine is vast and the girls working on the bar were lovely.  It would be unfair to rate it low as I suspect its a great place if you are with a bunch of friends, its just not the type of place to go if you're on your own.

data.title: Great Vibe!
data.text: We stopped in at this charming place down a short alley in Napa on Friday night. They have a nice selections of beers and wines. We sat at a table and had a bottle of wine with great service from one of the co-owners. As the evening progressed the placed filled with hip and beautiful young folks. It was most enjoyable!

data.title: Find Cadet!
data.text: This place was recommended to us by a few locals when we asked about places that are open past 10 pm.  It's down a corridor from 1st street and another street.  This is a great atmosphere, not fussy, and has great food/beer/alcohol/coffee selection.  We were there on a Friday and Saturday night, and it was really busy.  You have a chance to pick the vinyl record too!  Totally worth it.

data.title: The "Everyman"'s wine bar....and more
data.text:
This is a Tasting Room to the World, but it's about as big as a minute, which is perfect! If you are done with every tasting room along the Napa Wine Trail.

How about you step up to the Euro-industrial bar and just give the lady a direction-Domestic? Foreign? Something that is weighty as a Chardonnay but not a sissy wine, a let's -get-busy white that will cleanse your palate and set up up for that Prosciutto plate.  

Yeah, that's what I mean, the wine, the bread, the kick from a little 'moutard francais' with a full grain wheat batard, it's got that kind of thing goin' on and in the background, Mr. James Brown is layin' down some solid soul tracks, it's all about the vibe, man.

Strictly an evening operation, so don't show up before 5 pm.  If I lived here, this is where I'd hang.  I don't do beer, but the wine selection and the introductions are what do it for me.

data.title: Head to Cadet!
data.text: Loved Cadet! Awesome music, menu, and design! We stopped in for a quick snack before a late dinner reservation and found ourselves wanting to stay far longer than one drink. It was the perfect place to get a taste of how locals spend their evenings after work without feeling like an obvious tourist. The menu was far more extensive than you might think for a snack bar. If I lived in Napa, I have a feeling I'd be at Cadet all the time.

data.title: Great wine bar in downtown Napa
data.text: We stopped in for a glass of wine before dinner in downtown Napa on the recommendation of one of the vineyards we had visited during the day.  It turned out to be a great choice.  The list of wines by the glass included several more unusual/limited choices.  There was plenty of indoor and outdoor sitting and the bartender was very friendly.

data.title: Nice Wine & Beer Bar in Downtown Napa!
data.text: Really liked it here. Really nice waitresses and felt very at home. It was quiet when I went at 5PM. I like how they play records. Extensive list of beer and wine. Few bites available also.

data.title: Great Vibe!
data.text:
Cadet was a nice little spot to stop for the evening and have a glass of wine or a cold beer. 
Bartenders are very friendly and made excellent suggestions. The bar had a really cool vibe, complete with an awesome record collection.

data.title: Amazing wine.
data.text:
Cadet was incredible. They had the best prosciutto in the world. We ordered a bottle and got to play a cool LP.
Fantastic

data.title: Cool Place with Cool Vibe
data.text: Just was hopping around town for some drinks and met a friend here.  I think I am in love.  I am a HUGE vinyl record collector so it was so cool to see all the music in the joint is played from their vinyl.  Fun collection too.  They have a fantastic beer/wine menu with great variety.  Also a cool patio which fits the bill perfectly.  Tucked away down a dark alley makes this place especially fun to find.  Check it out, you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Nice venue with vinyl
data.text:
Great wines, relaxed atmosphere  tucked away a little off the Main Street. 
Played classic vinyl on a fabulous sound system. 
Pleasant friendly staff
A hidden gem

data.title: Vinyl + big beer & wine list
data.text: Recommended by our waiter at Coles chop house. Small, very hip / younger crowd. Fun place to grab a drink to cap off you're night.

data.title: Fantastic spot for a glass of wine or a beer!
data.text: Recently opened, this has quickly become one of the coolest joints to visit in downtown Napa.  They have an excellent wine and beer selection, curated by the two female owner-sommeliers.  The music is 100% vinyl, which really adds to the fun atmosphere.  Good times!

data.title: Nette Bar
data.text:
Freundliches Personal, 
Etwas basslastiger Sound,
Biere und Weine aus der ganzen Welt mit sehr unterschiedlichen Geschmacksrichtungen
